item.title: Rate My New Design
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

I dont have a link proving that he took it from another site, but for my knowledge I can tell you it isn’t his.

First the slide image has “removable water mark” on it, so that was a give away to check his image directory.
In his image directory(http://google.co.uk/index/images/) He has other slides for that top box with the same thing on them “Removable watermark”

Next up when you go to the logo.png it gives this logo “http://google.co.uk/index/images/logo.png”

Another thing is a real webdesigner of what he claims to be at in wouldn’t use “http://i48.tinypic.com/2h7qxjm.png” to host files or for his links in his source code “http://google.co.uk/index/client.php” He would actually just use /image/whatever.png or /whatever.php to redirect or load images.
[hr]
replace google with his website url by the way.

Read full topic

item.title: Rate My New Design
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Sibor:

Are you kidding me? Tell me someone who codes like that? Also when it’s bunched up like that, it’s because it’s been copied and pasted into notepad and then saved and then uploaded!

That is common practice to reduce bandwidth when the client requests the files. White space can be nasty especially when it isn’t needed. http://www.cssminifier.com/

[quote=“KroniKz_, post:29, topic:470012”]This is a theme by Dziner studio…
omg stupid moparscapers. He didnt make it, it was designed by dzigner studio, he payed $45…
theme is called “Gearbox”[/quote]
That is painfully obvious on the forums, however I don’t see anything shared on the homepage which is what he was asking for the critique.

@OP The footer image is extremely low quality with the way it fades out. Using an indexed format?

Read full topic
